website_summaries.verdict: Reliable numeric keypad that works with Macs and PCs. Easy to use, ideal for anyone who wants a keyboard with style.
pros: Boasts easy set up via 36-inch USB cord, allowing users to use this 18-key device
Has handy bottom switch to indicate use with a “PC” or “Mac.” Works with myriad of operating systems
cons: May be taller than your standard Mac keyboard

customer_reviews.title: If you have to deal with numbers, you need ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have to deal with numbers, you need this pad for your laptop. Simple to use, just plug it into your usb port and go. I take the time to review purchases because I know that I rely on them myself and I like to try to help others make informed decisions. If my review was helpful to you, please click the "Helpful" button.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: No delete key
customer_reviews.text: Descent external 9 key keyboard, however it does not have a "delete" button (don't get fooled by the "Back Space" button) which is why I really wanted the external keypad. It is a little thicker than expected. I returned it because it didn't have a delete button.
customer_reviews.author: Katie R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use with MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: This keypad replaced a Belkin wireless keypad, which required a battery. I found that the battery was usually "dead" when I wanted to use it because it would turn on when a key was pressed. This was handy when preparing to use it, but a problem when traveling with it in a suitcase! The Satechi keypad plugs into my computer, so there'll be no problem with dead batteries. I've only used it once with a spreadsheet on my MacBook pro, and it was very easy to use. I plugged it in, and began to work. The length of the cord is perfect--I attached it to my computer on the left side, and I'm right handed.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy N.

customer_reviews.title: I just wanted more...
customer_reviews.text: I am not saying that this is a bad calculator or number pad but I did return it because I want a little bit more and a number pad. So I am planning to spend more money and buy one of the more expensive ones. But this is a very basic number pad which will serve you well if you are tired of entering numbers across the top of the keyboard in a straight line which I find very annoying. I just wanted more.
customer_reviews.author: RealNewYorker

customer_reviews.title: My MacBookPro doesn't like it
customer_reviews.text: My MacBookPro 2012 did not recognize this, but it allowed me to use it. Numbers seem to enter fine, so it will work for me. The tab takes you to the cell below the one you just typed and the bk sp, erases what you just typed. I had a bluetooth Satechi that also had a forward and backup (not erase) keys, but it sometimes worked and sometimes didn't. That is why I bought this one with USB.
customer_reviews.author: csinbryan

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Mac
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars despite the plasticky built (which was openly disclosed, but the price matches that, so it deserves full rating). It has a nifty switch on the back for selecting the right mode (PC or Mac) which I have scotch-taped over since I only use it for Mac. I use this only when traveling and stationary, so it gets gentle and little use, thus my review is not based on hardcore use. 5 stars because it fits the price and fulfills its promises to me.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Holden

customer_reviews.title: this thing is excellent. The quality is definitely slightly lacking
customer_reviews.text: Price wise, this thing is excellent. The quality is definitely slightly lacking. But for what you paid, it is what it is. Obviously this is not a aluminum casing as you might have dreamed of getting it for this cheap. The buttons aren't as smooth as the macbook air I have. However, price, price, price!! You have to put in a consideration that this is a budget 10 key. I myself is very happy with it as it does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Does not match dimensions.. so expect it not to line up with your iMac Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. The picture shown does not show that it doesn't match the real iMac keyboard. This number pad is taller and the prints on each number is much lighter than that on my iMac keyboard. And since it dont line up because its not the same size/height I can use the connect bar to attach it together as one looking unit. I wouldn't have purchased it if I knew that.. But it works so I took off one star for being a little deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this! I really needed it for quicker data entry. The reason for the loss of one star - it's annoying that the MacBook wants to set it up as a full keyboard every time you plug it in, but you can ignore that and it still works. Also, the little bump on the 5 is too subtle for my tastes. I bought some cheap adhesive gems for my daughter and used one to put in the middle of the 5 button and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Renee J

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately it didn't work for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed an extended keyboard to set up shortcuts within InDesign. Unfortunately this number pad won't work because there is no number lock. Annoyingly there is no clear button either. Which would be helpful if you are using it as a calculator. The packaging was really tough to get into, I had to cut through the plastic to get it out. So I can't return it. It was easy to set up with my MAC and as other reviewers said is plastic not aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: DanniG

customer_reviews.title: Great service.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon and Satechi helped resolve my issue, great work team, upgrading to 5 stars I really wanted to like this but the buttons stick. I tried "mashing" them a little to try and get them un-stuck but no luck. I threw away the packaging so I am out of luck from a return perspective. I would keep looking
customer_reviews.author: Frank H

customer_reviews.title: Good......as long as you don't use a Thunderbolt Display
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is a great companion to the Apple keyboard that does not have the numeric keys on the side.......IF you are plugging it into your MacBook directly. I use a thunderbolt display and plug the usb directly into the Thunderbolt display. The keypad works initally, then will not work at all. I tested it by plugging directly to my MacBook Pro and it worked flawlessly. However, if you use a Thunderbolt display, you use that as a docking station and plug all your accessories there. Unfortunately, this keypad does not work in that fashion. Back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleReviewsItAll

customer_reviews.title: Works well for Accounting class
customer_reviews.text: I am a college student who is going into Accounting. I purchased this to use with my Mac computer. I really like the keypad and it works great for school. I wish that the numbers were black instead of grey, but that is okay. I can see them okay, they just seem a little faded. I've had no problems with the keypad so far, although I have not used it a whole lot yet.
customer_reviews.author: Gracetoyou

customer_reviews.title: Great for Apple Macbook Pro!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so last November, after having Windows and Linux laptops, I decided to seek out the "Dark Side" and try an Apple Mac Book Pro. While I really like the laptop, I was missing the numeric keypad that I had on both the other laptops. When doing any type of numeric data entry, this is a MUST! It is well-constructed yet lightweight and I wish I hadn't waited so long to get this.
customer_reviews.author: 1912 House

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure when purchasing but decided to give it a try as I missed my side number keys that weren't on my new laptop. It works great! The only thing I can't figure out how to turn off the key sounds, they are very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: nanc

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without this before???
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I googled for something I thought it didn’t even exist and found this amazing object. It literally takes me 20 minutes less to finish my math homework and it spares me the anger I incour in every time I had to use the linear number keyboard of my MacPro
customer_reviews.author: Eleonora

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, works well, priced right
customer_reviews.text: While not being finished off between the housing and the keys with the tight tolerances of a genuine Apple product this keypad looks right at home sitting next to my iMac and it works well. I have it plugged into my Anker usb hub and it has alway worked. The price was right and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard! I do my financials on my laptop and I hated not having a number pad. My first keypad popped the "enter" key about ten days after I received it, so I contacted the company. They sent me a replacement and a label to return the first one. I'm very happy with it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Book Indexer

customer_reviews.title: Nice but feels a little mushy after a few months ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice but feels a little mushy after a few months of use. I think the coating on the keys wears off a little fast but they just don't feel as nice as they did when they were new. I think this is a common thing for all products that aren't the big L brand.
customer_reviews.author: rxblitzrx

customer_reviews.title: Tricky setup with MacBook Air
customer_reviews.text: Four stars because I had to change some computer settings before it worked, but now it's working just fine. For Mac users: check your accessibility settings to make sure Sticky Keys is turned off and you have unchecked the "ignore built-in trackpad when mouse or wireless trackpad is present."
customer_reviews.author: Mylorac

customer_reviews.title: nice feel
customer_reviews.text: This number key pad is really nice. I had another one for years, and I got tired of the clunky feel - big keys that are hard and noisy to press. This one has a really nice touch. I'm glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: A. G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for larger hands
customer_reviews.text: Nice 10 key. The buttons are the perfect size for someone with larger hands. I've purchased others that were smaller and had a hard time just hitting one button. This works perfect for me. I go with the usb cord because I've had several problems with others that are wireless when connecting to my mac. This thing you just plug and go. No set up.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: My mistake - Basic numeric keypad. NO calculator functions/not for accounting use.
customer_reviews.text: Though this product was received in a timely manner and appeared to be a good product, after opening and hooking it up to my MacBook Pro it was apparent I had made a mistake in ordering and had to return. (Thanks Amazon for your great return policy.) If you're like me and are looking for an "accounting/calculator type keypad this is not it. There are no memory function, mode, send or clear keys. It is strictly a basic numeric keypad with only backspace/delete and tab key. A more appropriate option maybe the Satechi Bluetooth Wireless Smart Keypad for iMac, MacBook Air, MacBook Pro, MacBook, and Mac Mini.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline L.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd known that "brushed-aluminum finish" means "plastic painted silver"
customer_reviews.text: This certainly gets the job done, and looks nicer than the standard thick black keypad, but it is painted plastic and the keys differ slightly from a standard Apple keypad (double check if this is important to you).
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: I own two
customer_reviews.text: Best numeric keypad I have owned. I purchased a cheap one prior and it was a piece of junk. Not only does this one match the look and height of my iMac keyboard, the touch also matches. I tend to slide it away from the keyboard until I am doing numeric entry. Better than I had expected. In fact, I have purchase another identical keyboard to use at school with my Macbook Air. UPDATE: One of my two went bad. Outside of warranty. Contacted Satechi and they replaced it anyway (I had to ship the bad one back).
customer_reviews.author: John Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Use right away so you know it works
customer_reviews.text: Well bought this last year for school and never used it. Decided to use it and the dang number 1 key won’t work after 3 days of use. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S Mcfadden

customer_reviews.title: which I like in a number key pad
customer_reviews.text: It matches the Apple keyboard exactly in appearance. It worked immediately as soon as it was plugged in with no install procedure needed. The key press feeling is positive and a little longer throw than the alpha keyboard, which I like in a number key pad. I received it on the promised date. All told, an excellent value for the money. I have no reservation in recommending this key pad and I would feel good about ordering other products from Satechi.
customer_reviews.author: Partking

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 months ago, when I started working from home. I use a 10 key every day for work, but my laptop did not have one. This plugs into my USB port on my laptop. I really liked the sleek design, which would match my Macbook very well. It lays at an angle, which I prefer. However, after 2 months of use, the 1 is starting to rub off on the key itself. The key still works fine, but the finish is rubbing off. This is the reason I did not give it 5 starts
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Works great. However, I returned it and bought a wireless one that doubles as a calculator that i really love.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good addition. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Has the feel of the wireless keyboard. What I like is the "enter" key (return) on lower right - easier than Apple "return" key, especially since I use a PC with "enter" key part of the time. Good for us who "hunt and peck".
customer_reviews.author: thefredster

customer_reviews.title: I like this keypad for the most part but it doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this keypad for the most part but it doesn't have a CLEAR button, so when I try to use it with my computer's calculator, I have to move my hand back to the key board if I want to clear what I typed. The UNDO button doesn't work with the calculator. I am using it with a MacBook Pro laptop. It was also a hassle trying to get my Macbook to recognize it using bluetooth. Part of the trick was simply to ignore some of the things the bluetooth menu said. I found the way to do it somewhere online but I don't remember the web site. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Nalley

customer_reviews.title: Stylish looking keypad
customer_reviews.text: Like the design, dislike the quality of the 10-key. It takes some effort to type each number: I have to press TWICE for some numbers to print. Wanted a silver keypad. Had better & more reliable ones (but those were black), and my laptop is silver... Still works for me.
customer_reviews.author: masik

customer_reviews.title: Everything I expected
customer_reviews.text: The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because it is on the cheap side of quality and don't know how long it will actually work. This review was asked for only 2 days after arrival. I normally like to offer a review a month after purchase for the obvious reasons. So far it is everything I expected and a great solution for a numeric keypad when on a tight budget.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Shlifer

customer_reviews.title: Works great in a library setting
customer_reviews.text: I am a librarian at a public high school and this has made my job so much easier. When you get 30 loud teenagers in a room and try to hear them to look up their names, it can be a challenge. With our library program, you can look up a student by their ID number. I have this on my desk and the kids can enter in their ID number. I then verify their name and scan the book they are checking out. Best $15 I have spent!
customer_reviews.author: Jen Rio

customer_reviews.title: Super easy, just plug in and it works like ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this because my Mac doesn't have a number pad next to the regular keyboard. Since I use Excel frequently, it got to be quite a nuisance using the number keys on top of the keyboard. This was just the thing I needed! Super easy, just plug in and it works like a charm! The buttons feel great, it works seamlessly, and it's nice having the long-ish cord so I can place it wherever is convenient while I have other things laid out on the desk. Only have had it for a few weeks or so, but right now I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Hallie M. Bowie

customer_reviews.title: Great keypad - used in MAC and PC
customer_reviews.text: This pad is great. The only quirk is the “-“ is lower than it normally is on a 10-key and in the space where it normally is, there is a backspace key. So many times when entering data, I hit backspace rather than “-“. Otherwise it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: ktlibs

customer_reviews.title: number keypad brings joy
customer_reviews.text: works great with my MacBook air. I do a lot of spreadsheet work and simply couldn't go without a number keypad. Would give a 5 star. But a couple of the keys are sticky. If they loosen up a bit I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unusable within a short period
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife's laptop. It stopped working after just a handful of uses. When plugged in it outputs random keys and is completely unusable. Took it apart to check if it was a loose connection, but that was not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Rumsey

customer_reviews.title: Deserves 5 stars but...
customer_reviews.text: Deserves 5 stars but I spent many hours trying to get it to work on my PC. No where in the documentation did it say there was a tiny switch on the bottom of the unit to set it to PC or MAC. Had I known that it would have set up a lot easier because it came set to MAC. On a laptop without a NumLock Key you still might have a little work to do. Other than that it deserves 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Georgebee

customer_reviews.title: Not for use with Pro Tools
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 10-key pad to use with Pro Tools 12. It does respond when entering numbers; however, it does not respond when modifier keys (Like Command) are required in conjunction with a number.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Life

customer_reviews.title: Works great although may need to remap keys depending on your application.
customer_reviews.text: Seems very nice so far. I'm using this for a left hand keypad for Sibelius on an iMac, so I can use the mouse with my right, and I had to remap the top row of keys, since they don't correspond exactly to the keys on a standard Macintosh keyboard. However, Karabiner was able to remap the keys without trouble. Otherwise, looks nice, feels solid, and works well.
customer_reviews.author: David Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Love this keypad!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mac laptop, which does not have the ten key on the right. I really miss that when working with a lot of figures. It was hard to find an external 10 key that was comparable with the mac. This one is perfect. It arrived on time, and was a simple plug and play. It works great, sits at a slight angle, with the top being a bit higher than the bottom. Easy to keep up a good speed by feel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should and matches Apple keyboard perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should. I really like that it matches my Apple keyboard so well. Looks like they could have been packaged together. Wish it had cost a little less!
customer_reviews.author: Karen L

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for My Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly, well packaged and exactly as presented. It functions great and matches up cosmetically well with my other aluminum finished accessories. I chose the corded version for the simplicity of the keyboard. I just did not need the other features of the Bluetooth offerings and wanted a minimal footprint. I use it for music notation input giving me numeric keypad options now at either end of my QWERTY keyboard so either hand can be on the midi keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: In the Burbs

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up
customer_reviews.text: This is a great number pad and extremely easy set up. All I did was plug it in and began typing. I will recommend this product to anyone in need of a number pad.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear007

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard addition. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this product. I plugged it in and it works perfectly. Of course, would be nice to have it wireless, but from what I saw on other reviews, wired works better. The look is not the same as the apple wireless keyboard, but close enough to look nice next to it (slightly less angled, key numbers are a lighter gray, slightly clunkier). But to add this functionality, at this price, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: lauren2846

customer_reviews.title: Works great! My Macbook kept saying it doesn't recognize the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My Macbook kept saying it doesn't recognize the keyboard but i just ignored it and opened up a word document and it worked immediately. The only thing I wish I would have noticed is that it doesn't have an equal (=) sign. As an Accounting major, it would have been nice to notice that to begin with but if you don't mind jumping back and forth between this and the keyboard - it is excellent. Other than that - I am very happy with it. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Austin H.

customer_reviews.title: Too bad.
customer_reviews.text: The description says in addition to working with Macs that it also works with Windows Vista, 7 and 8. I mistakenly assumed it would work with Windows 10. It does work with my MacBookAir, but will not work with my Windows 10 HP laptop, and that is where I have Quicken and wanted to use it. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Fifer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice number keypad, ideal if you have a Macbook and need to constantly input numbers.
customer_reviews.text: This number keypad is a very good product. Looks and feels very similar the the original Apple keyboard. The aluminum body feels very good. The keys are a bit taller and stiffer than in the original Apple full size usb keyboard, but not bad. Great number keypad if you have a Macbook and work a lot inputing numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas C.

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: It's good, does its job. Pure plastic, the stainless steel look is fake.
customer_reviews.author: MarcoC

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it does the job. The keys are a little sticky, especially the “0” key. I actually have to take time to push down the key instead of just seamlessly pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great keypad for an iMac
customer_reviews.text: Bought this keypad to go with my new iMac - this is not a perfect match on the height of the new keyboards but it works well and it certainly looks a lot better than a black or white plastic. It would be nice if this keypad was backlit, if it were I would not hesitate to get it a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H.

customer_reviews.title: It's really nice looking, and the keys are better than I ...
customer_reviews.text: Hooked right up to my Macbook Air. It's really nice looking, and the keys are better than I thought. I thought they would be really soft, and hard to tell if you pressed them. They're not. It's extremely easy to tell when you're pressing a button. So far, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Meyer

customer_reviews.title: I like how well it matches my Mac
customer_reviews.text: I like how well it matches my Mac, but the only thing I don't like about it is that I don't think the key connections are very good. Sometimes I type some numbers and it doesn't register that I've hit them so I have to go back and punch them in pretty hard.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Krotz

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Does what it supposed to do, seems good quality, I like that it doesn’t need a battery or to be charged
customer_reviews.author: Ping Pong Flix

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value. However, though in the pictures it looks like it will complement the Apple keyboard, it is not level. Also, it is made of plastic. It works great though.
customer_reviews.author: kenocentric

customer_reviews.title: Works great, looks good
customer_reviews.text: My Mac computer doesn’t have a 10 key so I ordered this. It works great and while it doesn’t exactly match my Mac keyboard, it’s close enough and the price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Norma S

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a good product and works as expected. However, I find the "enter" key to be annoying. On my computer keys, the "enter/return" key will return to the beginning of the first cell that was initially selected in EXCEL, however when hitting the "enter" key on the numeric keypad, it only goes to the cell below it. I find this annoying when trying to enter several values in multiple columns in one row and need to do the same in the following row.
customer_reviews.author: doraemon97

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Works like a charm. Has good feel and looks like it came with my brand new iMac. Easy to hook up; pretty much, just plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Beware Seller

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I can't function without a 9 keypad, and my new apple magic keyboard doesn't have one. I ordered this one and it has speeded me up on my input. I would have like it 5 stars except the size of the keys are larger than "normal" and that take a little off, but it works just great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly...
customer_reviews.text: I have just switched from a pc to a Macbook Pro. The Mac doesn't come with a 10-key pad, so I bought this one. I kept books for many years and missed having a 10-key built into the laptop. Now, with this one, entering numbers is easy again. I'm very happy with it! (And it matches my Mac.)
customer_reviews.author: CathyAnn

customer_reviews.title: It's a normal USB numeric keyboard that looks good next to your mac
customer_reviews.text: It's a normal USB numeric keyboard that looks good next to your mac. But, once again, the buyer is subject to the "mac tax" because of it. It's plastic. It's not metal. In my opinion, it's not worth the price. But it looks good...
customer_reviews.author: Queen Ren

customer_reviews.title: Quite nice.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Arrived quickly and on time. The only complaint I have is that I can't figure out how to turn the noises off! I have a Lenovo yoga and it's great but every time I plug it in and go to type up a lab report, I get these annoying beeps when I press the keys. User error probably but it's still annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Ravyn Frey

customer_reviews.title: Great key pad
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a quality keypad. No num lock button which is great for me.
customer_reviews.author: BLONGNM

customer_reviews.title: Great Numpad Substitute for MacBook.
customer_reviews.text: This numpad solves the problem of Apple's fool decision to remove numpad functionality from newer MacBook models. It works flawlessly and the typing feel is very similar to your MacBook keyboard, so it feels very natural. This is a great option for those not wanting to spring for a good BT model.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick G.

customer_reviews.title: Numeric pad works well with Mac
customer_reviews.text: I like that the keys have the same touch as my Mac keyboard (same pressure required to press the keys). It sits slightly higher than my keyboard, but not noticibly so; as far as use. It does look slightly different due to the difference in size.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelia

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built & works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I know it seems silly, but with all the number crunching I have to do, my wirelss apple keyboard just doesnt cut it. Solidly built & works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Upstate Robot

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, and it does what I need it to. I mainly use it for quickbooks and spreadsheets.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall young

customer_reviews.title: HIgh quality plug n play beautiful device.
customer_reviews.text: Such a life saver! As an accountant (using a client's Mac) this helped me speed up my work. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Elif Soyarslan

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today. Plugged into Mac and started working perfectly right away
customer_reviews.author: BobBuilder

customer_reviews.title: love it, wished it would of been wireless
customer_reviews.text: I am a lefty and one makes a key pad on the left side. so now i can move it anywhere. love it, wished it would of been wireless, next one i get it will. Thanks you for a great product
customer_reviews.author: Eloisa De La Garza

customer_reviews.title: "." key doesn't work on Mac
customer_reviews.text: Viewed support forums and help online, and can't make the "." point key work. It puts an "," instead. Very frustrating because the math operations don't give correct results.
customer_reviews.author: José R.

customer_reviews.title: It is very nice in that it matches the other hardware
customer_reviews.text: My mac, which is only one month old had difficulty recognizing this keyboard. It kept confusing it with a lettered keyboard. Not sure how I did it, but after about 30 minutes of playing with the settings, I was able to get the computer to differentiate between the two keyboards. It is very nice in that it matches the other hardware. VERY fast shipping. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Rita B.

customer_reviews.title: Works well with 2016 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Works well with my 15" 2016 MacBook Pro, and was ready to go as soon as I plugged it into the laptop. It requires an adapter to convert to USB C for the new MacBook Pros, but this doesn't seem to interfere with functionality. I'm also happy with the tab button feature, which helps with shifting cells when using Microsoft Excel.
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Great Keypad - Does not work with Chrome OS
customer_reviews.text: Nice sleek keypad. Great size and the buttons press nicely. Did not work on my desktop running Chrome OS, though. Another comment confirms it didn't work on their Chromebook either.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: This product works really nicely and is good looking to boot
customer_reviews.text: I need a 10key to do my Accounting job. and when I was working from home on a laptop, I was very slow on the number keys. This product works really nicely and is good looking to boot. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: emilyruth

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I got this keypad for my Mac because I only have the small wireless keyboard that came with it. I'm an accounting major, so I needed it for homework.
customer_reviews.author: Katelynn Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my son (8) so he can type ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son (8) so he can type numbers in faster for his math exercises. The big buttons all in one location are helpful for his little hands.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Wong

customer_reviews.title: It is really very useful
customer_reviews.text: My job is the accounting, and I feel that now I can type numbers faster!
customer_reviews.author: Andres Franco

customer_reviews.title: Love this numeric keypad
customer_reviews.text: Love this numeric keypad! I wanted something light, easy to use and compact. This keypad did the trick. It was super easy to set up (just plug in the usb) and worked great. If you are looking for a non complicated numeric keypad..... this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Trixie

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive But Doesn't Look Like It
customer_reviews.text: “Yes, it is plastic and the keys feel different than an Apple keyboard but it does everything I want. It is inexpensive, connects automatically when I plug it in and speeds up entering grades. While it is taller than a wireless keyboard I have mine attached to my track pad with a MeshWe and it is exactly the same height.”
customer_reviews.author: Philip P.

customer_reviews.title: My mac needed it.
customer_reviews.text: It works perfect with my mac. I so needed this when adding numbers, it just much easier. Would definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Monaysmom

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Keypad
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Was easy to get up and running. Only wish it had arrow keys and that it was wireless but, for the price, it is awesome. Makes life a lot easier than hunting and pecking for number keys. As an ex-accountant, I missed my ten key. Works perfectly with my MAC.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy LT Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I previously had a 'LMP Bluetooth Keypad WKP-1314' ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I previously had a 'LMP Bluetooth Keypad WKP-1314' and it was awful, never stayed connected. Love that this one connects via USB, so easy to use, I don't have to worry about it losing connection, or changing the batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Grass Maven

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This numeric keypad is easy to use and works very well. I'm using it with a MacBook Pro and I'm very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: JGS

customer_reviews.title: The keypad you always wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I have a laptop that I use for Quickbooks entry. What a pain that the keyboard doesn't have a numeric keypad! But with this item I can fly through my work with ease. And it's attractive at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: A good fit with my Apple keyboard and trackpad
customer_reviews.text: A good fit with my Apple keyboard and trackpad. It would fit better if it were a little thinner. Bluetooth would be even better...
customer_reviews.author: Segv

customer_reviews.title: but just hit delete and it works great.
customer_reviews.text: When I plugged it in my computer thought it was a letter keyboard, but just hit delete and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Enlightened Despot

customer_reviews.title: Mac and PC Compatible with Good Tactile Buttons
customer_reviews.text: The keypad plugs easily into any computer. I have a MacBook Pro with OS X Yosemite and it recognized the keypad immediately; I also use the keypad on Surface Tablets with Windows 8 at University and the keypad has no trouble switching between the two different operating systems. The buttons press very similarly to that of an Apple Keyboard. I have a glass desk in my room, and even when I am inputting entire financial documents for class, the keypad does not budge which is something I greatly appreciate. My only issue is that the keypad is only slightly more elevated than the Wireless Apple Keyboard that I use.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty Worley

customer_reviews.title: Good value and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Good value and looks good. Works well but for me the keys slightly higher and stiffer than I would like. Perhaps over time that will get better. Others may find it feels great to them.
customer_reviews.author: Papidad

customer_reviews.title: This does not work with a Mac when it is ...
customer_reviews.text: This does not work with a Mac when it is using Boot Camp. The description that says it works with Windows 7. The number keys do not work when you are using 7 on Boot Camp.
customer_reviews.author: knowledge seeker

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! It works so well and the buttons are slightly raised so your fingers glide so easily over them. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: CZM

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great the second you plug it in! No problems yet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it felt like i had to really push hard to use them ...
customer_reviews.text: keys were relatively sticky and did not mimic the quality of my macbook. it felt like i had to really push hard to use them after the flow of apple keys
customer_reviews.author: dana flett

customer_reviews.title: This works great on my Mac
customer_reviews.text: This works great on my Mac, and I also use it when I access my Microsoft remote server from my Pac. I had one problem with the Num lock turning on in my remote environment, but the tech support team was very responsive and helpful, and the issue was resolved in no time!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Nice keypad. Plugged it in and it worked right ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice keypad. Plugged it in and it worked right off the bat. Have had no problems with it. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: clippergear

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine, a bit sluggish after a time and takes ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine, a bit sluggish after a time and takes some getting used to, but makes data entry so much faster...
customer_reviews.author: Hybrida Designs

customer_reviews.title: I will be returning this product. For some reason ...
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning this product. For some reason it would not work with my MacPro. I gave it three stars since the company reached out to try to reach a solution.
customer_reviews.author: GIlm

customer_reviews.title: cable is too short!
customer_reviews.text: Cable WAY too short to be used on a desk top.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Two "+" keys!
customer_reviews.text: It works. Mine has to "+" signs on it but the top one was actually a "-" sign. I kept it because it worked & there was no need to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Junot

product_meta.title: Satechi Aluminum Finish USB Numeric Keypad - 18-Key USB Number Pad - Compatible with MacOS & Windows Devices
product_meta.description:
The sleek Satechi Aluminum USB Numeric Keypad is the perfect accessory for your workspace. This keypad was designed with iMacs and MacBooks in mind with its brushed-aluminum finish and Apple-style curved edge. An attractive and functional accessory for any workspace, the Satechi Aluminum USB Numeric Keypad adds a number pad to your existing keyboard for quick and comfortable data entry. 

Ultra-thin Design
Toss this thin and compact keypad in a laptop bag or briefcase to efficiently enter data wherever you go. 

Easy to Use
Simply plug this keypad into an available USB port and it’s ready to use. No drivers or other software downloads are required to use this keypad. 

Compatibilities
Mac OSX 10.4 and up Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8
feature_bullets: Easy to install – no drivers required, plug-and-play, permits hot-swapping
Brushed aluminum finish – matches iMacs and MacBooks
Compatible with: Mac OSX 10.4 and up; Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars523 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
